file_content.text: Thank you again. For everything.
Our long-range sensors just picked up the explosion inside the geothermal plant. Nice work!
The Imperials will be furious. I wish I could see their faces....
Our sensors didn't pick up any explosions, did something go wrong?
I chose to stay and fight the Imperial Army.
Everything went fine.
I stayed to fight the Empire.
You forgot to mention there were innocent colonists in there. Defending them from the Imperial assault was something of a challenge.
You could say that.
You fought the Imperial Army? On your own? Are you serious?
For such a small group of people to take out an entire army... that's astonishing!
The stories I've heard about Jedi don't do you justice.
Havoc Squad may just put the rest of us out of a job, Captain.
Remind me never to cross a spacer.
For one person to take on an entire army and live to tell the tale is... remarkable. I've never seen anything like it.
Thank you. You've probably just saved the lives of half the soldiers on Hoth.
If everything here is secure, Major, I'm probably needed elsewhere.
I should go.
A simple task, really.
Typical day for Havoc Squad.
That was a piece of cake.
Glad to help.
There are a lot of people on Hoth who could probably use your help.
Listen, I know this is asking a lot, but we've lost contact with Lieutenant Kieral at Senth Outpost....
I don't know what's happened there, but I suspect they're in trouble.
You know, you might want to go see Admiral Revald in the ship graveyard.
He's in charge of the biggest, most critical mission on Hoth. If there's anywhere in the sector you should be, I think that's it.
The last transmission we got from Aurek Base said they were under attack. We haven't heard anything since.
There's a good chance the base has been lost. You might want to look for survivors.
Then I wish you a safe journey, wherever your travels take you next.
I'm not sure how much time we have before the Empire seizes the power station. Good luck out there.
Yes, sir!
This is from Imperial Intelligence. It looks like... it's a strategic assessment of the Ortolan geothermal power station. Maps, avenues of attack....
The geothermal station is currently held by the White Maw. If the Empire takes it from them... we're in trouble.
Exactly what will happen if the Empire's plan succeeds?
How much trouble?
Who or what are the White Maw?
The White Maw?
Pirates. Hoth is crawling with them. They took the geothermal station from the Ortolan colonists who built it.
I'm not fond of trouble.
It will be a disaster for this outpost as well as the entire Republic operation on Hoth.
Capturing the power station would give the Empire a completely self-sufficient fortified base on our doorstep.
They'd be able to launch attacks from there with impunity. We'd never drive them out.
What do you suggest we do to stop them?
Do you have a plan?
So the datadisc says, "You're all going to die."
That's bad news.
Then you'll have to defend it.
So we'll capture it, first.
I can handle this.
We don't have the manpower to defend that power station. Once you leave, the Empire could just take it.
There's only one thing to do: Destroy it before they get there. Take these remote charges.
It's too bad. We could certainly use it.
What a pity.
One explosion, coming up.
Blow it to smithereens? Is this really the best plan you could come up with?
Not the most subtle approach.
It's not ideal, but we can't let the power station fall into Imperial hands.
The Empire got to your Chiss defector, but the datadisc was still on his body.
The target was dead on arrival, but the datadisc appears to be intact.
Turns out the blue guy was telling the truth: The Empire killed him. I found the datadisc, at least.
It's just as well. I'm not sure the men really wanted a Chiss hanging around here.
The data disc is the critical thing. Let's get a look at it.
Lieutenant! We need this decrypted.
Don't get yourself killed over a Chiss. Bring him back if you can, but don't take any chances.
Well, this is a surprise.
Welcome to Outpost Cresh. We're understaffed, far from everything, and basically, the outpost the galaxy forgot.
I'm sorry to say, you've just arrived in the least important outpost in the sector, Master Jedi.
Good to see you, Captain. Normally, I'd say Havoc Squad would be better off closer to the front.
You've got good timing. Normally, I wouldn't expect anyone to come to this outpost, let alone a spacer.
Welcome to Outpost Cresh. Usually, this is the least important place in the sector.
But we just got a break that could make this the hottest spot on Hoth: We got a message from one of the Chiss.
They contacted you? There's likely some trickery involved.
Are you certain it's real?
I agree with you completely. Ordinarily, I wouldn't trust it, but....
It's time they realized how much we out-class them.
To surrender?
Not exactly, Captain.
Finally get that dinner invitation?
What sort of message?
Why is that important?
The Chiss are the Empire's best allies here on Hoth. This message is a phenomenal break of luck for us.
Aren't they allied with the Empire? What did they want?
An Imperial blue guy called?
Here, I'll let the transmission speak for itself.
Republic outpost, do you copy? I'm under heavy fire, and I haven't got much time.
I've stolen a datadisc of time-sensitive information from Imperial Intelligence. I am offering this to you in exchange for sanctuary.
The Empire is hunting me; I don't know how long I can hold out. Send help, and I'll give you whatever you want!
You wouldn't be showing me this if you thought it was just an Imperial trick.
You believe him, don't you?
I think that Chiss would never choose to appear weak, even to bait a trap. He has to be desperate.
This could be trouble.
So do I. But if it's true, we haven't got much time before he and his datadisc are gone.
There's no way a Chiss would actually betray the Empire. This has to be a trick.
I think he's lying.
If it's true, though, we're about to lose a potential ally and a weapon against the Empire.
If we're going to act, we have to act fast.
If he's telling the truth, it's too great an opportunity to pass up.
I'll check it out.
Thank you. Outpost Cresh can barely defend itself; we don't have people to send on a rescue mission.
Thank you, Master Jedi. This mission is way beyond anything my people could manage.
I was hoping you'd say that, Captain. Havoc Squad is the only outfit in the army that could pull this mission off.
I'm relieved to hear you say that. I don't have anyone who could pull this off; you're our best hope.
Thank you. There aren't many people in the galaxy who'd go out on a limb for this guy.
The signal came from a crashed dropship not far from here.
Be careful. Bring the Chiss back if you can, but if it does look like a trap... get out.
You want me to go rescue him, I take it.
By, "we," you mean me.
We don't have the manpower. If anyone is going to save him, it's got to be you.
Too risky. [Refuse quest]
I understand. I wish I could change your mind, though.
Things are a bit busy right now.
Plant the charges in the station's energy transformers, then get out. We'll blow the place sky-high.
